frameDefinitions: Under some Condition, usually left implicit, a Responsible_party is required to perform some Duty.
A Speaker makes a commitment to an Addressee to carry out some future action.
An Agent is responsible for having intentionally performed an Act or for being the or a primary instigator behind the Act.
A Defender responds to an Assailant's attack on a Victim by directly, and usually violently, countering it.
The Accused enters a Plea in answer to the Charges.
Unless a particular Required_situation obtains, Negative_consequences will follow.
frameExamples: It is my <t>duty</t> to fight any attack on the Brotherhood .
You <t>promised</t> me you'd come to my graduation.
It has been determined that a relatively unknown terrorist group is <t>responsible</t> for the recent attacks.
Samantha stalwartly <t>defended</t> the gateway from the wraiths, crouching low over Stephen's prone form.
He made it clear that he would <t>plead</t> guilty to indecent assault.
You <t>must</t> turn in your test by 5 p.m.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who must perform the <fen>Duty</fen>.
The action that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform.
The time interval during which the Responsibly_party is obligated to fulfill the Duty.
A location in which the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> has a specified <fen>Duty</fen> .

The Speaker is the person who commits him/herself to do something.  Speaker is usually the External Argument of predicative uses of the target or the Genitive modifier of a noun: <fex name='Speaker'>Jo</fex> made a <t>promise</t> to me. <fex name='Speaker'>Jo</fex> <t>promised</t> me she would cook dinner. <fex name='Speaker'>Jo's</fex> <t>promise</t> to cook dinner came to nothing.

The Speaker's commitment can be made to an Addressee.  With those words which allow this frame element to be expressed, Addressee usually occurs as a PP Complement headed by <ment>to</ment> or the (Indirect) Object of verbs: Kim made a <t>promise</t> <fex name='Addressee'>to me</fex>. Kim <t>promised</t> <fex name='Addressee'>me</fex> that everything would be okay.

An expression of the commitment made by the Speaker expresses the frame element Message.  Message is expressed as a finite or non-finite clausal Complement or an NP Object: I <t>swore</t> <fex name='Message'>that I would never make the same mistake again</fex>. The owner finally <t>consented</t> <fex name='Message'>to sell the business</fex>. They <t>threatened</t> <fex name='Message'>revenge</fex>.
Topic expressions are not very frequent in this frame. They can occur with noun targets. Jo made endless <t>promises</t> <fex name='Topic'>about working harder at school</fex>.

As with other frames in the Communication domain, the <t>Medium</t> of communication may be expressed. Medium is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the Message. Bob <t>threatened</t> the workers <fex name='Medium'>in Spanish</fex>.
The time period during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the commitment.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the commitment.
This role identifies the <fen>Act</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs intentionally.
The <fen>Agent</fen> performs the intentional act.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> acts intentionally.
This role identifies the place where the intentional act occurs.
This role is the being or entity that responds forcefully to the <fen>Assailant</fen>'s attack.
The person (or other self-directed entity) that is attempting physical harm to the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The individual or entity that is under attack from the <fen>Assailant</fen> .
This role identifies the time when the Defender takes forceful action against the Assailant.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Defender</fen> defends the <fen>Victim</fen> from the <fen>Assailant</fen>.
The judge of the court in which the accused enters a plea.
The person entering the plea in court.
The crime with which the Accused is charged
The <fen>Plea</fen> that a defendant makes.
The <fen>Court</fen> is the institution before which the plea is entered.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The state-of-affairs which prevents <fen>Negative_consequences</fen>.
The period during which the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is necessary to prevent negative consequences.
The location within which the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is required.
listRoleExamples: My job is <fex>to get to the other side of the bridge</fex>.
<fex>At that time</fex> men were obligated to marry women from their own community.
I almost forgot to tell you that <fex>in Sweden</fex> we are obligated to spend atleast 7.5 months in the army for training.

The chancellor <fex>yesterday</fex> promised to increase defence spending in real terms next
year.
The july framework has reaffirmed what was promised <fex>at Doha</fex>.
<fex>Joy Peterson</fex> pleaded innocent to the murder of his son.
Simpson pleaded not guilty <fex>to the murder of his wife</fex>.
The student pleaded <fex>guilty</fex> to stealing a bike.
He was told that <fex>when he got back</fex> , his column needed a serious rethink .
<fex>In California</fex> , seatbelts must be fastened at all times .

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Uniform Code of Military Justice
Treason, Bribery, or other high Crimes and Misdemeanors"
